intro: Schefflera chimantensis, commonly known as the Chimanté Schefflera, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is characterized by its dense, compound leaves that are typically arranged in a whorled pattern around the stem. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, berry-like fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
